Member Function Documentation

void SystemManager::addSystemState ( SystemState *  state  ) 

Register a new SystemState.

This method doesn't actually activate the state but makes it available for use by changeState.

Parameters:
state The SystemState to be added.
Remarks:
If state has already been added nothing will happen.

Definition at line 167 of file SystemManager.cpp.

void SystemManager::changeState ( const std::string  newState  ) 

Change the currently active SystemState.

Parameters:
newState The name of the SystemState to switch to.
Remarks:
If newState does not match the name of any added SystemStates nothing will happen.

Definition at line 182 of file SystemManager.cpp.

void SystemManager::changeStateNextUpdate ( const std::string  state  ) 

Safe method of changing SystemStates which ensures that the current frame finishes before the SystemState is switched.

Parameters:
state The name of the SystemState to switch to.
Remarks:
If state does not match the name of any added SystemStates nothing will happen.

void SystemManager::start ( const std::string &  initialState,
const std::string &  windowTitle 
)

Start up the system, starts the rendring and update processes.

Parameters:
initialState The initial SystemState to start the System with.
Remarks:
If no SystemState named initialState has been added to the SystemManager bad things will happen :).
